intro: Micranthea, commonly known as the small-flowered plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and often hairy foliage. The plants are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Micranthea species usually have opposite leaves and produce showy, often tubular flowers in shades of pink, red, or white. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
